lab5TicTacToe

Class AI

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab5TicTacToe.TicTacToe
      • lab5TicTacToe.AI

  • public class AI
extends lab5TicTacToe.TicTacToe
    This class will hold the player versus computer methods, it uses the same methods as the TicTacToe class only it has a AI layer This class only works on 3x3 boards, and the first player will always be the X, although you can specify which character the computer is
    Author:
    Ylva

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char computer
      This character will be the character that the computer has to play with

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AI()
      Default constructor, sets board size to 3, sets the starting player to X and the computer to play with 0
      AI(char computer)
      Constructor that sets which sign the computer should start with Sets the board size to 3x3, Sets the starting player to X and the computer to the input

      Will find the first empty place in a column and return that, will return a 4 otherwise Should be used after the columnWinPossible method

      Will return an integer that has the first empty place in the diagonal from top left to bottom right.
      private int findWinRightDiagonal()
      Checks for the first empty place in the diagonal from top right to bottom left If this is 0 it means 3,1 if it is 1 then it is 2,2 if it is 2 it is 1,3 these values are not the array values

      Will find the place where the player can win, will return 4 if no place is found.

        Returns:
        true if it is the AI turn

      • rowWinPossible

        private boolean rowWinPossible(int row,
                     char player)
        This method will check if it is possible for the character specified by player to win in the specific row
        Parameters:
        row - the row to check
        player - the char to check for
        Returns:
        true if the specified char can with just one move win the game

      • columnWinPossible

        private boolean columnWinPossible(int column,
                        char player)
        Will check if it possible for any player to win in a specified column
        Parameters:
        column - the column to check
        player - the char to check for
        Returns:
        true if the specified char can win with just one move

      • leftDiagonalWinPossible

        private boolean leftDiagonalWinPossible(char player)
        Will check if it is possible for any player to win in the diagonal from top left to bottom right
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        true if the char can win in one move

      • rightDiagonalWinPossible

        private boolean rightDiagonalWinPossible(char player)
        Will check if it is possible for any player to win in the diagonal from top left to bottom right
        Parameters:
        player - the char to check for
        Returns:
        true if the char can win in one move

      • findWinRow

        private int findWinRow(int row)
        Will find the place where the player can win, will return 4 if no place is found. Should be used after the rowWingPossible method Will check for the first open space and return that
        Parameters:
        row - the row to check
        Returns:
        an integer with the column where the player has a spot to win (if any)

      • findWinColumn

        private int findWinColumn(int column)
        Will find the first empty place in a column and return that, will return a 4 otherwise Should be used after the columnWinPossible method
        Parameters:
        column - the column to check
        Returns:
        an integer with the row where the first empty place is (which if columnWinPossible returns true will be the place where a win is possible)

      • findWinLeftDiagonal

        private int findWinLeftDiagonal()
        Will return an integer that has the first empty place in the diagonal from top left to bottom right. If this integer = 0 then the place is 0,0 in the game array, if 1 then it is 1,1 etc Should be used if the leftDiagonalWinPossible is true
        Returns:
        the first empty the place in the diagonal

      • findWinRightDiagonal

        private int findWinRightDiagonal()
        Checks for the first empty place in the diagonal from top right to bottom left If this is 0 it means 3,1 if it is 1 then it is 2,2 if it is 2 it is 1,3 these values are not the array values
        Returns:
        the integer location of the first empty place in this diagonal

      • enterMove

        private void enterMove(int row,
             int column)
        Enters a move for the computer to place a move in the specified location
        Parameters:
        row - the row in which to place a sign
        column - the column in which to place a sign

      • forkPossible

        private boolean forkPossible(char player)
        Will check if a fork is possible this method is horribly inefficient but it will do for now
        Parameters:
        player - The char to check if it has a possible place for a fork
        Returns:
        true if there is a place for a fork
